text: sharing this here as a follow on to the recent discussions of worker coops, to get more input: <https://twitter.com/heartpunkk/status/1449077274225958915|https://twitter.com/heartpunkk/status/1449077274225958915>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/heartpunkk|@heartpunkk>: SRE/PLT/systems ish folks (or any techies interested in working around those areas): how many of y’all would be interested in doing your work as part of a worker/platform cooperative? why? why not?

plz RT for reach
attachments.text:
SRE/PLT/systems ish folks (or any techies interested in working around those areas): how many of y’all would be interested in doing your work as part of a worker/platform cooperative? why? why not?

plz RT for reach

elements.text: sharing this here as a follow on to the recent discussions of worker coops, to get more input:

text: I've been interested in the concept, but AFAICT whether I would want to join in real life would depend very strongly on the details/execution. I didn't put a ton of time into researching it, but my impression was there's not a lot you can actually conclude about an organization just from it calling itself a "coop".

elements.text: I've been interested in the concept, but AFAICT whether I would want to join in real life would depend very strongly on the details/execution.
